intro: Stypandra grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered stypandra, is a flowering plant native to the south-western region of Western Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with woody stems and alternate, simple leaves. Its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and the plant is adapted to the arid and semi-arid environments of its native habitat. Stypandra grandiflora plays an important role in local ecosystems and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
